meanings.definition: The side or part of something that is in shadow or darkness during the night.
meanings.sent1: The nightside of the house was cold and mysterious.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to stay on the nightside of the street where it was quieter.
meanings.sent3: The nightside of the forest seemed to whisper secrets in the dark.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like the nightside of the moon, hidden and untouched.
meanings.sent5: The nightside of the mountain loomed ominously in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: The dark or shadowy side of a planet or celestial body.
meanings.sent1: The nightside of the moon was a vast expanse of darkness.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers study the nightside of planets to understand their composition.
meanings.sent3: The nightside of the asteroid was a mystery waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a lonely satellite orbiting the nightside of a distant planet.
meanings.sent5: The nightside of the galaxy held secrets beyond imagination.

meanings.definition: The period of darkness between sunset and sunrise.
meanings.sent1: The nightside brought a sense of calm after a busy day.
meanings.sent2: Children are usually asleep during the nightside of the day.
meanings.sent3: The nightside was when the nocturnal animals came out to play.
meanings.sent4: In the nightside, the stars painted the sky with their shimmering light.
meanings.sent5: The nightside was his favorite time to stargaze and ponder the universe.
